meanings.definition: A person who shows off their abilities or possessions in a boastful manner.
meanings.sent1: The showoff in class always brags about his high grades.
meanings.sent2: She is such a showoff with her new car, always talking about how fast it is.
meanings.sent3: The showoff at the party kept talking about all the expensive vacations he's been on.
meanings.sent4: Her brother is a real showoff, always flaunting his latest gadgets.
meanings.sent5: The showoff in the group constantly tries to outdo everyone with his stories.

meanings.definition: To display or exhibit oneself or one's possessions in a boastful manner.
meanings.sent1: Don't showoff your new phone too much, it might make others feel bad.
meanings.sent2: He loves to showoff his guitar skills whenever there's a chance.
meanings.sent3: She decided to showoff her dance moves at the party and impressed everyone.
meanings.sent4: The peacock likes to showoff its colorful feathers to attract a mate.
meanings.sent5: The magician will showoff his tricks at the talent show next week.
